table.name: fam_access_control_privilege
table.remarks: Access Control Privilege is a cross-reference object that allows for the identification of who are the delegated administrators(User) for an Application for a particular role.

column.name: access_control_privilege_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a User administers the Application role.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Unique ID to reference and identify the user within FAM system.

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Unique ID to reference and identify the application role within FAM system.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_app_environment
table.remarks: Used by the application to indicate its environment.

column.name: app_environment
column.remarks: Application environment.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of what the app_environmentrepresents.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was effective.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record expired.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_application
table.remarks: An application is a digital product that fulfills a specific user goal. It can be a front-end application, a back-end API, a combination of these, or something else entirely.

column.name: application_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of an Application registered under FAM

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: app_environment
column.remarks: Identifies which environment the application is for; DEV, TEST, PROD etc.

table.name: fam_application_admin
table.remarks: Application Admin is a cross-reference object that allows for the identification of who are the administrators(User) for an Application, as well as which Applications the User can administer.

column.name: application_admin_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a User administers the Application.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Unique ID to reference and identify the user within FAM system.

column.name: application_id
column.remarks: Unique ID to reference and identify the application within FAM system.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_application_client
table.remarks: FAM needs to know the OIDC client ID in order to match to an application. The relationship between OIDC client and application is many-to-one because sometimes there is more than one OIDC client for an application and it is convenient to be able to configure the authorization once (at the application level) and re-use it (at the OIDC level).

column.name: application_client_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of an OIDC as it corresponds to an identified client

column.name: application_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of an Application registered under FAM

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_forest_client
table.remarks: A forest client is a business, individual, or agency that is identified as an entity that a user can have a privilege "on behalf of".

column.name: client_number_id
column.remarks: Sequentially assigned number to identify a ministry client.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: forest_client_number
column.remarks: Id number as String from external Forest Client source(api/table) that identifies the Forest Client.

table.name: fam_group
table.remarks: A group is a collection of roles. When a group is assigned to a user, the user indirectly assumes the privileges of all the roles encompassed by the group. Groups are used to defineprofiles in order to make it easier to manage common sets of roles for users. A group can contain roles from multiple applications in order to handle the case where users typically have a certain set of privileges across multiple applications.

column.name: client_number_id
column.remarks: Sequentially assigned number to identify a ministry client.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a Role within the FAM Application

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_privilege_change_audit
table.remarks: Audit log tracking privilege changes, including details of the change, performer, and target user.

column.name: privilege_change_audit_id
column.remarks: Identity column acting as surrogate primary key

column.name: application_id
column.remarks: Foreign key to fam_application. Specifies the application for which the privilege change was made.

column.name: change_date
column.remarks: Date & time of the privilege change. For initial data migration, this is NOT the same as the create time of this audit record.

column.name: change_performer_user_details
column.remarks: JSON-formatted document describing the user that performed the change.

column.name: change_performer_user_id
column.remarks: Specifies the user that initiated the privilege change. Foreign key to fam_user. Nullable when access was granted by a system change.

column.name: change_target_user_id
column.remarks: Specifies the user that the privilege change was performed on. Foreign key to fam_user.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created. Not necessarily the same time as when the privilege change occurred.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or system account that created the record. Not necessarily the same as the user that performed the privilege change.

column.name: privilege_change_type_code
column.remarks: Foreign key to fam_privilege_change_type code table. Identifies the type of privilege change (Grant, Revoke, or Update access).

column.name: privilege_details
column.remarks: JSON-formatted document describing the privilege(s) being changed. E.g. For end user permissions, this is details about the fam_role(s).

table.name: fam_privilege_change_type
table.remarks: Table containing types of privilege changes such as Grant, Revoke, or Update access.

column.name: privilege_change_type_code
column.remarks: Primary key that identifies the type of privilege change (Grant, Revoke, or Update access).

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the privilege change type.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: Date when the privilege change becomes effective.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: Date when the privilege change expires or is no longer valid.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: Date when the record was last updated.

table.name: fam_role
table.remarks: A role is a qualifier that can be assigned to a user in order to identify a privilege within the context of an application.

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a Role within the FAM Application

column.name: parent_role_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a Role within the FAM Application

column.name: client_number_id
column.remarks: Sequentially assigned number to identify a ministry client.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: role_type_code
column.remarks: Identifies if the role is an abstract or concrete role. Users should only be assigned to roles where role_type=concrete

column.name: display_name
column.remarks: Human redable name for the role

table.name: fam_role_type
table.remarks: A role type is a code that is associated with roles that will influence what can be associate with a role. At time of implementation an abstract role can only have other roles related to it, while a concrete role can only have users associated with it

column.name: role_type_code
column.remarks: role type code

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of what the role_type_code represents

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date and time the code was effective.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date and time the code expired.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_user
table.remarks: A user is a person or system that can authenticate and then interact with an application.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a User within the FAM Application

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: user_type_code
column.remarks: Identifies which type of the user it belongs to; IDIR, BCeID etc.

column.name: business_guid
column.remarks: The business guid of the user if is a business bceid user.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: The first name of the user

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: The last name of the user.

column.name: email
column.remarks: The email of the user.

table.name: fam_user_group_xref
table.remarks: User Group Xref is a cross-reference object that allows for the identification of Groups assigned to a user, as well as the users that belong to a given Group

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a User within the FAM Application

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_user_role_xref
table.remarks: User Role Xref is a cross-reference object that allows for the identification of Roles assigned to a user, as well as the users that belong to a given Role

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a User within the FAM Application

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a Role within the FAM Application

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: user_role_xref_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a FamUserRoleXref within the FAM Application

table.name: fam_user_terms_conditions
table.remarks: User Terms Conditions records identify the users who accept the terms and conditions, as well as the version of it.

column.name: user_terms_conditions_id
column.remarks: Automatically generated key used to identify the uniqueness of a terms and conditions acceptance record.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Unique ID to reference and identify the user within FAM system.

column.name: version
column.remarks: Number to identity the version of the terms and conditions the user accepted.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

table.name: fam_user_type_code
table.remarks: A user type is a code that is associated with the user to indicate its identity provider.

column.name: user_type_code
column.remarks: user type code

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of what the user_type_code represents.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date and time the code was effective.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date and time the code expired.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.
